{{Wireless embedded system |brand=Z-Com |model=XG-580 |revision= |upc= |ean= |asin= |price= |est_release_date= |fcc_date=06/18/2004 |manuf_country= |manuf= |manuf_model= |manuf_rev= |availability= |type=bridge |fcc_id=M4Y-04-580 |ic_id= |pwr_v=5 |pwr_amp=2 |pwr_conn=barrel |pwr_barrel_inner= |pwr_barrel_outer= |pwr_barrel_len= |pwr_vac= |pwr_pol= |pwr_poe= |cpu1_brand=Marvell |cpu1_model=88W8510 |cpu1_cspeed= |cpu2_brand= |cpu2_model= |cpu2_cspeed= |fla1= |fla1_brand= |fla1_model= |fla1_num= |fla2= |fla2_brand= |fla2_model= |fla2_num= |ram1=8 |ram1_brand=EtronTech |ram1_model=EM638325TS-6 |ram1_num= |ram2= |ram2_brand= |ram2_model= |ram2_num= |expansion_if_types= |expansion_pcmcia_num= |expansion_expresscard_num= |expansion_minipci_num= |expansion_minipcie_num= |expansion_usb_num= |jtag= |serial= |wi1_module= |wi1_module_if= |wi1_chip1_brand=Marvell |wi1_chip1_model=88W8510 |wi1_chip2_brand=Marvell |wi1_chip2_model= |wi1_chip3_brand= |wi1_chip3_model= |wi1_802dot11_protocols=bg |wi1_ant_conn=RP-SMA |wi1_txchains= |wi1_rxchains= |wi1_sstreams= |wi2_module= |wi2_module_if= |wi2_chip1_brand= |wi2_chip1_model= |wi2_chip2_brand= |wi2_chip2_model= |wi2_chip3_brand= |wi2_chip3_model= |wi2_802dot11_protocols= |wi2_ant_conn= |wi2_txchains= |wi2_rxchains= |wi2_sstreams= |eth_none= |eth_cpu=true |eth_chip1_brand= |eth_chip1_model= |eth_chip2_brand= |eth_chip2_model= |eth_chip3_brand= |eth_chip3_model= |sw_cpu= |sw_brand= |sw_model= |lan_speed=100M |lan_ports=1 |wan_ports= |flags= |tp_firmware= |802dot11_protocols=bg |default_ssid= |default_ssid_regex= |default_ip=192.168.0.10 |default_user= |default_pass=default |oui= |oui_eth= |default_ch= }} "XG-580 V05" is silkscreened on the board in the FCC photos.
Sold by 2Wire (Wireless Gaming Adapter, 7400-000137-000). According to the FCC test report, this device was also rebranded by '''CastleNet''' as the WE9241.
Default credentials are from the FCC submitted manual.
